> > From the point of view of stability, I suggest keeping the logic as it is, in benchmark case, consumer is not one instance, if we change , the code will complex
> 
> During testing, it will appear as long as the tps of a single consumer reaches the threshold.
> 
> In my last benchmark, the production rate finally stabilized at 40w-50wtps, a single consumer reaching 6w-7wtps will trigger the current limit, when I use 4 consumers, there will still be some queues that cannot be consumed and accumulated.

As a comparison， you can set netty highwatermark   higher value  in benchmark,for eg 4M.

The throttling mechanism provided by Netty should suffice. I do not see a reason to complicate it. Further, caching data in RetryTaskQueue instead of the application/network buffer is not a good idea.

> hi, can i hava a try? 😄

Hi @nowinkeyy ,

Welcome to our community. Seems like you're trying to get started on RocketMQ. This issue has been fixed by others. How about helping us solve another small issue: https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/issues/5122
@RongtongJin Pull request should NOT be merged till all concerns are clarified.

@azhsmesos  You are welcome to figure out issues with the failing test cases... Actually, I have been fixing them for a while. Filter pull requests with Infra Improvement Project, and you would see a few resolved similar issues.
@Oliverwqcwrw Either Uncounted Loop or Sleep(0) is fine, IMO. Be sure to add proper documentation, explaining the purpose of  `sleep(0)` or `long-uncounted loop`.

The pipeline file may be named either `automate-snapshot.yml` or `snapshot-automation.yml`

The current file name sounds weird.

> @Oliverwqcwrw Either Uncounted Loop or Sleep(0) is fine, IMO. Be sure to add proper documentation, explaining the purpose of `sleep(0)` or `long-uncounted loop`.

agree with :)
